etymologies: mid 16th century (as a mathematical term): from Latin quadratura ‘a square, squaring’, from quadrare (see quadrate)

definitions: the process of constructing a square with an area equal to that of a circle, or of another figure bounded by a curve.
shortDefinitions: process of constructing square with area equal to that of circle, or of another figure

definitions: the position of the moon or a planet when it is 90° from the sun as viewed from the earth.
shortDefinitions: position of moon or planet when it is 90° from sun as viewed from earth

definitions: a phase difference of 90° between two waves of the same frequency, as in the color difference signals of a television screen.
shortDefinitions: phase difference of 90 degrees between two waves of same frequency
